profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Greensburg, Pa., November 26, 1815; received private instruction and attended Greensburg Academy; was graduated from Jefferson College (now Washington and Jefferson), Canonsburg, Pa.; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1836 and commenced practice in Greensburg; member of the State senate in 1852 and 1853; held several local offices; elected as a Democrat to the Thirty-third Congress (March 4, 1853-March 3, 1855); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1854 to the Thirty-fourth Congress; resumed the practice of law in Greensburg, Westmoreland County, Pa., and died there September 15, 1858; interment in St. Clair Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1794-1856, 55 items.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Augustus Drum contain letters from clients and lawyers concerning legal matters and land transactions; surveyor's returns and warrants, 1794-95, 1832-54 (30 items); letters to Congressman Drum relating to veteran's claims from the Revolutionary War, the War of 1812, and the Mexican War, and civilian claims against the government.
